tasks.title: Setup Flask Backend Server
tasks.description: Create the main Flask application file (`app.py`). This file will handle HTTP requests, serve the frontend, and manage the analysis workflow.
tasks.details:
- Initialize a Flask app.
- Create a root route `/` to serve the `index.html` file.
- Create a `/analyze` route (POST method) to handle file uploads.

tasks.title: Create Frontend User Interface
tasks.description: Develop a simple user interface using a single HTML file (`index.html`). The interface will allow users to upload their Excel file.
tasks.details:
- Create a `templates` folder.
- Inside, create an `index.html` file.
- The HTML should include a file input element and a submit button.
- Add basic JavaScript to send the uploaded file to the `/analyze` backend endpoint and handle the file download response.

tasks.title: Integrate Core Analysis Logic
tasks.description: Copy the existing `analysis.py` script into the project and integrate its functions into the Flask backend.
tasks.details:
- Copy `analysis.py` from the original FPA project to the `FPA_WebApp` directory.
- In `app.py`, import the `analysis` module.
- In the `/analyze` route, after receiving a file, call the sequence of analysis functions from the module on the uploaded data.
- Generate the final Excel file in memory using pandas and io.BytesIO.

tasks.title: Finalize Dependencies and Documentation
tasks.description: Create a `requirements.txt` file for easy setup and provide simple instructions on how to run the application.
tasks.details:
- Create a `requirements.txt` file listing all necessary Python libraries (e.g., Flask, pandas, openpyxl).
- Create a simple `README.md` file with instructions to install dependencies (`pip install -r requirements.txt`) and run the server (`python app.py`).

tasks.title: Test the End-to-End Workflow
tasks.description: Perform testing to ensure the application works as expected from file upload to result download.
tasks.details:
- Run the Flask server locally.
- Open a web browser and navigate to the application.
- Upload a sample `.xlsx` file.
- Verify that the analysis runs without errors and that the resulting `analyzed_data.xlsx` file is downloaded correctly.
- Check the contents of the downloaded file to ensure all sheets and data are correct.
